items.text: This sample shows DivViews displayed inside a UICollectionView. Each cell is an independent DivKit card.
DivKit makes it easy to display images with text overlays and rich formatting.
“The best way to predict the future is to invent it.”
Each card in this collection is fully independent and powered by DivKit's server-driven UI engine.
Start creating beautiful server-driven layouts with DivKit today.
DivKit layouts are described in JSON, making them easy to update from the server without an app release.
Unlikely friendships make the best stories. DivKit supports rich image layouts with rounded corners.
Use DivViewPreloader to pre-calculate layout sizes before displaying cards in a UICollectionView.
Gradients bring depth and visual interest to your layouts.
1. Instant layout updates without app releases
2. Consistent UI across iOS, Android, and Web
4. Rich component library out of the box
DivView supports intrinsicContentSize, making it compatible with Auto Layout in UIKit.
“Talk is cheap. Show me the code.”
Images can use any aspect ratio.
Templates let you define reusable components. Define once, use everywhere in your card JSON.
Cards can be updated in real-time from your backend without requiring users to update the app.
“First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.”
Use actions to handle taps, set variables, change states, and trigger timers — all from JSON.
Reduce JSON size by 80% with reusable templates.
Wide aspect ratio for cinematic layouts.
Variables let you store state within cards. Update them with actions to build interactive experiences.
Cards work beautifully in both light and dark color schemes. Design your cards to match your app theme.
“The only way to do great work is to love what you do.”
Visibility actions trigger when elements scroll into view. Great for analytics and lazy loading.
Same image, different aspect ratio. DivKit handles it all.
DivKit supports expressions: use @{variable_name} in any string property to make it dynamic.
Patches let you update parts of a card without re-sending the entire JSON. Great for live updates.
Square crop shows off the details of this adorable duo.
“Make it work, make it right, make it fast.”
Timers can drive periodic updates within a card — perfect for countdowns, auto-advancing, or polling.
Connect with other DivKit developers and share your creations.
Each one rendered by DivKit inside a UICollectionView cell. Scroll back up to see them all.
